lines: Saints keep the lamps lit tonight.
Mud to the ankles, thunder to the heart.
Share your fire, brother—cold bites worse than lead.
She sells bandages by the chapel; tell her I sent you.
When the shells fall, count to ten and breathe.
New Antioch stands while we stand for each other.
Keep your blessings close and your head lower.
I heard the witch again—to the east, past the mills.
Trade a prayer? I’ve a spare.
Fortune favors the quiet step.
Water first, then bread; pride can wait.
Mend your strap—loose kit invites bad luck.
No man marches alone here.
Saints keep the lamps lit tonight.
Mud to the ankles, thunder to the heart.
Share your fire, brother—cold bites worse than lead.
She sells bandages by the chapel; tell her I sent you.
When the shells fall, count to ten and breathe.
New Antioch stands while we stand for each other.
Keep your blessings close and your head lower.
I heard the witch again—to the east, past the mills.
Trade a prayer? I’ve a spare.
Fortune favors the quiet step.
